one_reviews_text:
- Install
- Play the ~3min video
- Feel disapointed
- Uninstall as soon as possible
this game is just a robot finding his robot hands then saying hello to you and it ends there. this game sucks butt and should die
Cant get it to install using the app on two different PCs.  Other things have installed fine but this one refuses.  Pretty disappointed in that
I understand these were made when virtual reality first came out so can't really say anything negative apart from it's a little short. Love it though.
Its just a random VR video. you just stand and watch. Kinda waste of time imo
Awesome Real-time Experience
Im stuck in the ,,Start menu" and cant start it. I tryed everything, i even watched gameplay from that game on youtube. But all i can see is just black and an broken menu
Cute story, it was short but I enjoyed watching it!
tried playing this , at title screen no buttons work to actually start the experience
if u havent go watch the animation film "the iron giant" and u can appreciate more this short but great experience
i get how hard it is to make vr content, but this is 1.37 GB, and its just not worth it, its a waste of time, and its not even a game
waste of time i can only hear music and nothing else. Everything is completely black besides some 2d clouds.
The ending was so unexpected it made me smile
Seriously.....come on guys make something. I am sure you can do much better than this.

review_title: IT IS ABSOLUTELY NOT WORTH IT...
one_reviews_text: You spend more time downloading it, than using it, it's not interactive it's just a short video; and it's not even anything special, once the video was finished, it left me no emotion except a little frustration for the slow waiting for something interesting, that at the end, doesn't happen. I conclude by saying that the robot is a bad and ugly copy of "The Iron Giant", a 1999 animated film from Ted Hughes book and produced by Warner Bros. (if you have never seen the movie, I highly recommend you to watch it, you will not regret it )

review_title: just music and a black screen
one_reviews_text: using rift S

it is a short film around 3 minutes long but everything about it is so good, the graphics are done well, the sound matches up perfectly, and it is somewhat funny. to sum it all up i'd say that it is short and sweet movie.
This had my jaw dropping the entire time! Amazing experience but wish there was more to come :(

The experince kinda suck and if this VR video cost money than I don't recommand it but it's 2 star instead of 1 since it's free and VR video is ok but I heard there was ganna be a update for the game in which you could explore around which I hope is coming soon.
Only works for the oculus go. Wont start.
when i start the game its shows me  play or restart but nether option work.
Cute pupper, would own.
This is a beutiful cinematic but short at about 4ish min. May not spend money on it, but beutifully made and worth your while if free.

This is just so gorgeous! It is very short at around 5 minutes for everything but it is very good and just so nice to look at. Don't expect any interaction except for starting the experience. I'd not be too keen on spending money on it, maybe €1? It's just that it's so short. Still, as I got it forr free, I was satisfied with it.
this seems to be a huge iron giant ripoff and im not pleased at all.

you better keep it free considering the length and content
what a joke
Dark, short, loud... not very spactacular. It was a bad experience.

Three minutes, maybe? But, I'd still say worth a download. Super cute. Solid storytelling. Didn't crash with Oculus Quest Link. That's certainly a plus! Thanks, devs. Looking forward to the full release.

This is an amazing short for VR. I have had everyone watch this for not only the VR experience, but for the amazing slight audio cues. I so wanted this to be longer. I had my 11 year old watch this and she actually was happy at the end with the 2 being reunited. Please make more of this. We need more of this. I would pay to sit on that fellas shoulder and walk with him, watching the landscape go by. This is a rare piece to enjoy, and I hope more watch and enjo this as much as I have.

Thank you
One of my first games to try out on VR. The visuals were beautifully done, the story short and sweet. My only wish is for it to be longer! (Part 2, please!)

review_title: Short and simple, acceptable if free.
one_reviews_text: The store page description mentions that this product is only "free for a limited time", this rating is only applicable for a 'free' price tag. Although the VR viewpoint is handy for conveying scale in this 3D animation, it's very brief and doesn't feature any VR interaction. Totally fine and worth watching for free.
If you enjoy the Pixar shorts, you will enjoy this.  I would strongly reccomend playing this for a first time VR player.

review_title: Amazing, any hopes of a full game?
one_reviews_text:
Beautifully executed, amazing to watch, so sad its short but that does add to the experience
if there is a full game or story of this, i will be among the first to buy it
Someone worked hard on this, I'm sure. It wasn't very memorable and it's pretty far off the mark when it comes to what VR should do as a medium. Sorry, guys, I don't think you quite got it right.

review_title: u CAN play this with touch !!!
one_reviews_text:
I feel sry for the bad reviews... some people don't get it.

Just press the MENU button on the left touch controller and the movie will start.

It's short, but worth it.
This was an introduction to VR among a few others,I was awed by it,still kinda cool even compared to the monster vr experiences out now
JUST PLAYS OPEN SEQUENCE OVER AND OVER.  CONNECTED XBOX PAD STILL SAME RESULT.  U GET WHAT U PAY FOR... FREE LOL COST ME 30 MINS OF LIFE
I'm so glad i dropped 400 dollars today to find out that Oculus can't even be bothered to test games they say work on their platforms...

review_title: For those who can not play
one_reviews_text:
If like me you only have oculus touch and you can not press play. You have to use a xbox one or xbox 360 controller and it will work by pressing "A" for play and "Start" for restart. It's Working for me ;-)
Have a good day
I was expecting more and I did enjoy it. Only problem is it is very short, feels like only a beginning.

"Woah this is actually pretty cool"
"Yooo is that a robot?"
"HES GETTING CLOSER OMG!"
"aaaaand done"
It's pretty cool but waaay too short.
Gives me flashbacks of The Iron Giant.
This Game Has Incredible Graphics, Music, and Visual Representation. i felt like i was in another world when i played. 110% recommend for anyone looking for a quick adventure.

Beautiful graphical enviroment. Very short. You need a regular controler to start the game, which may be a problem for some. (it DOESN'T support touch as it says) My computer is gaming oriented so I have a reg (logitech) wireless controller.
This is quite short, but a very wholesome story. I don't want to spoil anything for you, but the animation is done really well and you'll smile towards the end.

review_title: How many years is it going to take?
one_reviews_text: ...to take 5 minutes to add support for Touch controllers?
why can't start movie???

review_title: Nice short. Doesn't work with touch ctrl
one_reviews_text: I used rift with a game pad. If you use game pad, press "a" it will start. Touch controllers doesn't work though.

I can’t press play because it seems you can only do it with the remote control from oculus go, controllers of rift are not working for this game. Could you please tell me how to play with the controllers? None of the buttons work to press PLAY
GREAT GAME YOU SHOULD DEFENTLY PLAY IT

review_title: Works fo rift: was not immersed
one_reviews_text: found the quality (1060 6gb) to be troublesome, the character didnt look as realistic as Robo recall does for me. touch controllers work. Press 'a' to play
Can't start the app due to the fact that the touch emulation did not work....and I only have touch controller.....and yes I have win 10 and no other controller conected!
Cute little VR movie, sit back and watch.
Very good short Video. I like it a lot.
It's a (really) short experience with good music and graphics
I only this what seems to be the remote and there is nothing happening
cute little video

The music, lighting, animation, is all so beautiful. I recommend this for people who want to show others who aren't great with video games a fun vr experience. No controls required. Just sit and look around, and enjoy a pleasant short film. (only a couple minutes)
but it's too short! unfortunately!

you don't need a Rift for this. No exploring and no interaction, well, what to say? 
I was expecting much more.
Not really a game but if you have a Rift I recommend looking at it, it's free.
Does not reckognize Touch Controler. Thus it can´t be started.
Geeky gfi ivy ICU
nice

I thought it was a nice interlude from the interactive stuff. This is a short film, maybe five minutes long, just enough time for a fun sequence of events to take place while you enjoy the sights and sounds.
Greatly enjoyed, only wished it were longer.
Not interactive. Well job!
A very short movie, good how you view from one spot and not moving about, fun bit of imagination, good job
I really loved it but sadly it's very short!

It's a very short, non-interactive, yet immersive VR video. Released in Mid 2016, around the time the Rift launched; it's fun to show people, especially fans of stuff like the Iron Giant and other big robot shows. It's free, so worth a watch.
this was very well made but did not last more that a couple minutes also kinda of hurt my neck when looking up

review_title: Touch controllers not working at all
one_reviews_text: Couldn't get my touch controllers to work in any kind of way with this. Same issue with Farlands.  Maybe post some instructions since the descriptions seem to indicate it should work.
This is not a game. It's a well done short movie, and a good way to showcase the Rift to friends and family.
I wanted more!!!!

review_title: The main action button just restarts
one_reviews_text: So I got bored within 1 minute of the slow pace and pressed the A button to see if there's any options. It just restarted the whole thing, so I had to just give up.

This is exactly something I had been hoping to see when VR started becoming the next big thing. Lost is short, sadly, but it more than makes up for it with showcasing how VR can be utilized. The video accurately shows how VR can make visual storytelling a whole new experience. I'm hoping to see more out of this sudio, or at least more things like this in the future! Simply amazing!
...and if you seen and liked The Iron Giant, is even better

Its really immersive and the graphics look good 
really short but overall great experience

review_title: Free, so I guess I can't complain
one_reviews_text: Downloaded it not having any idea what it was. It was pretty neat. not worth paying any omney for, but its pretty cool
if you love giant robots & the suspenseful feeling of being lose in the wood at  night, this game is a must play because it's free!
Great experience, but for some reason the screen keeps flashing red. (Same with Henry, the other game made by this company). If there was a fix for this problem I would rate 5 stars!
How do you start this with the touch controller?

I do not understand why this is getting hyped so much. It's buggy (had to use my xbox 360 gamepad to start it instead of the oculus touch) and the "film" itself is boring af. Don't get me wrong, I don't need action/ jumpscares etc. in a movie but if you know about the short animation movies by blizzard, packed with emotions, stunning visuals and lovely characters making you almost cry in a couple of minutes then lost is...nothing. 
It's not even a nice vr demonstration because it is dark all the time, objects lack in detail and there is simply nothing happening in the clip. Every trip with google maps vr has bigger "wow effects" than this.
Had to grin when the credits were displayed after 4 minutes and stated that more than 10 people worked on it. Whatever they did all the time.
The fact that the oculus shop states that this clip is free "for a limited time" is ridiculous. Sorry but..no.

this short film stole the concept of a massive robot that fell apart and all his body parts become sentient and want to reconverge to reassemble the big robot. This story focuses on a severed robot hand that moves and acts EXACTLY like the severed hand from the Iron Giant.

just when things get started the film just ends.
'free for a limited time' - dude, this is like literally a 3 minute animation. It's nice, don't get me wrong, but seriously, who would ever charge even a dime for this?
Just a 3D Short. Look around.
Took longer to download than to watch. Didn't realize is was just a non-interactive short. Really just a really just a reimagining (rip off) of The Iron Giant...
Well, the touch isn't working as gamepad. No reaction at all, can't even select "start".
But takes far too long to download for like 2 minutes of a short... It does show the potential of VR, but that's about it.

Everytime someone comes to my house to try the oculus for the first time, this is the first experience they get. And everytime there is the same reaction : a little fear at first, and then a big cheer. People always say : woaw. Job is done ;)

review_title: short play time but not bad
one_reviews_text:
it has 2-3min short play time.
movie qualtiy is not bad but their's no stroy
- if you could not strat the game with touch, you can use 'space bar' on your keyboard instead
Really nice, wish i could walk in such an amazing place

review_title: An EXCELLENT VR experience and intro!
one_reviews_text: I've read a few reviews stating that the gamepad nor touch controllers work, it's because it's a movie! An immersive movie that is. I highly recommend donwloading it and just enjoy the few minutes it lasts, add to it that it's an excellent way to introduce anyone to the VR experience.
Even though this was short, this was a stunning masterpiece!  The Story is great, the visuals are great, everything about this is great!
It states it "Supports Touch (As Gamepad)" but when I launch it I get stuck on the title screen where it says to press button to start. I only have touch controllers, is there a way to fix this?
Wonderful animation. I feel it ends a bit too soon, but it's well made. Fun to watch.
Looks amazing but is just 2 minutes of a visual experience. Who would pay for it? Doesn't even have gameplay.

Minutes in, the only thing i can do is restart...
i was waiting, and then the machine looked down at me, and my friend in the room (in real life) talked to me, i took the headeset off, and then put it back on and it restarted.
really???
i was waiting, and it seamed intresting, but even a book, you can set it down and pick it up. i couldnt resume this???
ill try once more but you guys need to work on the basics of technoigy and life and the fact that things hapen and pause and resume is an import aspect of technology.

This (very) short film creates probably the best atmosphere of all the VR films I've seen so far. It's just an easy 5/5 for the environment and sound but... It's so immersive that you will be left incredibly disappointed by the fact that it's just around 5 minutes in length. They could have done something amazing for the finale, like *SPOILERS* the huge robot actually lifting you up on his hand.

How can you give any of this technology less than a 5?  Those that create these wonderful short 3-6 minute "experiences" (let alone the real games) are amazing and I thank them and appreciate their creativity.  Can't understand the 1-2 star ratings.  If you want to share with your friends, family or kids VR; then download this short film and take it for what it is .... some fun, a break from life and truly incredible technology!  Thank you Oculus.
Got this while it was free. Well executed sound, visuals and pacing. I was standing there in awe.

I quite enjoyed it, nice graphics and sound. Really pleasing to the eye. I could manage to start it with my XBOX 360 controller.

Thank you.
Would've liked if it was longer.  :// The fact that it was like 4  minutes made me sad lol
I think the game is cool and cute!
Does not start!
Looks interesting and would love to play it, but it won't start no matter what buttons I push.
I love the iron giant vibes from this the hand and all OwO
Kids really wanted to play this. Can't get past screen with controller options.
This is really a cool stuff!
Gets to the press start to play screen but no buttons do anything !
Very short experience but it has a great universe (for those who love Iron Giant like me) and a wonderful artistic direction. Personally I had goose bumps!
gamepad dont work. cant start it.
It was beatiful, I agree that it's short but that really doesn't matter
It's short but very pretty and relaxing..
Can't start it with touch controlers

I actually searched this out after reading about Oculus Story Studio on Wikipedia - it was about using VR as a cinematic medium to create films - which is pretty amazing - just think in time a fully immersive film release with 360 deg video.... WOW! sadly Story Studio has been closed after releasing 3 demo films, Lost being the first... :o(

I too was excited when I read about Oculus studios effort to make stories in 360. I envisioned Star Trek holodeck type interactive stories.  If I understand correctly, they have abandoned the idea for now.  Possibly a task easier said than done. This was a poor example if that was their intent. Hard to believe it was done in the unreal 4 engine. Very dated looking graphics
psilocybin

You can skip this one as of Q3 2017 as there are way better free experiences to be had.

+: Clearly a reference to "The Iron Giant".
=: Uninspired and slow with almost nothing to see and no interaction.
=: No Oculus Touch support - had to use Xbox controller to initiate the experience.
=: Objectively one of the most boring VR experiences so far.
-: No particular negative aspects; ""Free for a limited time""…

I found this quite immersive compared to other apps. It is simply a stand and watch experience. It lasts around 4minutes. If you are downloading all the free demos after buying your new VR device then this should be one of them.
Reminded me of the Iron Giant. This is a fun VR experience. It is also very short!
This was one of the most immersive animations I have ever seen. I played this on the dk2 and was very good. My mom tried this and nearly cried!

** Free for a limited time. **
Is this a joke? You`re actually going to charge people for this very, VERY short, (non-interactive) clip? Whilst it`s cute, and well done, I cannot recommend anyone actually parts with money for it.
There's no weigh to the hand. It bounces around like it's made of cardboard. Otherwise not really much here.
Short but worth trying.
this is a very short clip, with little story that tells nothing. not really worth the time.

it's basically a tech demo. nice graphics, nice presence but that's it. there's no story, something happens and you stay there watching for a couple of minutes. that's it. 
probably worth watching but it left a sour taste in my mouth because as soon as I started enjoying it and wondering what was going on, it ended. really disappointing.
Did not work with oculus touch controller, could not start it, only displayed the remote on the screen which I do not own.
This is one of the better VR demo experiences, especially for those new to VR.  Short story, but you feel the scale of what's going on.  You will definitely feel small.
Really cute short, I have no idea why the age limit is over 13, this seems aimed at the whole family.

review_title: It's free so can't really complain
one_reviews_text:
It's a 4-5 minute "virtual experience" clip. Not going to say what's happening in it but in short - not much. You just sit and watch something happen and then that's it.

Get it if it's free, don't bother otherwise (seeing how it will have a price eventually).
I think this does a really great job at showing the potential for cinematic gaming in the future, but for now it's just a fun little short demonstration.
Free for a limited time? Will you charge people for this 3-4 minute non-interractive experience?
it was nice, but now i have this in my library and can't remove it.
So boring and no interactivity.

review_title: Pls, need more videos like this !
one_reviews_text: It's short but very lovely !!

I mean, I understand this is a short film, but not too much happened at all, and it was a bit slow to say the least.

Also unforgivable that you can't seek in the video, and no fast-forwarding or rewind.
Exciting what the technology can do.
Very beautiful graphics. Good thing I got it for free.. after watching once, uninstalling to make room for something else.
well made little animation that conveys scale in a way only vr can

review_title: Not sure why people give it less than 5*
one_reviews_text:
It is a short clip, maybe 2-4 minutes. No hands. You just stand and watch.

I really enjoyed it!
Short clips like this show that we are on the brink of something amazing in entertainment...in a few generation kids will ask us what were movie theaters like...and this is the beginning
We need the iron giant vr

review_title: Nice little demo with no ending
one_reviews_text: This short movie presents some of the features of the Rift. I really like the sounds, while the animation is edgy from time to time. The main problem is the ending, because there is none. The credits appear just when we got introduced to the 'characters'. But it's free and short enough to show your friends and family what the Rift is used for, so I'll still recommend this one.
Made me think of "The Iron Giant" movie, made me feel smaller!

Another quality production from Oculus Story Studios. This team is really leading the way when it comes to VR animations. The charm and smooth animations brings the character to life, and sense of scale really gives a sense of wonder and amazement.
Just a glimpse of whats to come with VR
A nice little demo of what future of entertainment could become.

...It would be 5 stars if it wasn't over before it really began. Really fantastic demo, that just ends prematurely leaving everyone with "huh!? That's it?" Please, at least make it so it leaves people satisfied when they take the goggles off.

This short film is about 1 minute long. What it has is very cool, but 1 minute long doesn't feel very satisfying. If you show this to friends who have never seen VR before their response will most likely be something like "Oh, nice potential... but where's the actual content?"
This was really good.  Really shows the potential of the Oculus Rift.  Please make more!
Just a short experience to demonstrate it's like to show a short scene in VR.  Give it a look.
short sweet the point vr movie well worth a dl
It is free. It is sweet. It is beautiful !!!
This is not a game but a Video Clip, shows the potiental of VR Kids will love it, download and enjoy.

best 3D movie experience out there!
can only imagine what a 30min movie could be like... and if its interactive... awesome!
Just a VR movie but its amazing how nerve racking these large robots are in VR. This is one of those things that wouldent make sense on a desktop window but in VR, its WOW - feels so much different.
Very short but interesting experience. If you have a Rift, download this.

I strongly recommend this one, it's amazing. And people, stop complaining on freecontent. And it's ok if it's free for a limited time, this people worked very hard putting all this great animation together, I'm sure it took months to work on this.

review_title: Great graphics and.... it just stops.
one_reviews_text: It's a great and promising start. Then the end credits roll. Could probably have been a part of the Dreamdeck demos to be honest. Not really long enough to warrant its own app. And free for a limited time? You're going to start to charge for these super short experiences? Or is this merely a trailer for a longer narrative?
Sweet VR-Movie
Really like the small cinematic experiences, this was definitely one of the better ones.
Spectacular
And as it usualy is in this sorts of films the story is really crapy. Still I do advise you to give it a try.
This is art.

This is one of the better experiences out there. The sense of scale and presence are amazing. It's made by a director from Pixar so it is no surprise the whole thing contains a kind of magic feel within it.
A good example of how a future Disney movie might look and feel like!
It's pretty simple and short movie but that's good thing for VR . This atmosphere and scale really shine in VR. My best experience in VR for now.
Really impressed with Lost . It gives a sample of what is possible in VR , The scale is unbelievable .Well worth a look
Incredible! Great sound.  Best for using as a VR Demo for friends and family.
Thank you for this wonderful experience!
my favourite vr experience...we need more stuff like this ^^

If you want to introduce your friends & family to VR, this would be on of my top picks. The Jurassic Park-esque feel, the immersive sound design and the awe-inspiring visuals make this a great, on the short side, experience.
It would be magnificent, if there was a simple(r) way to exit the app/movie..
good visual, but meh for the storyline
doesnt work on revive for me
my favourite vr experience...we need more stuff like this ^^
